summary: Systemic data quality audit triggered by NETFUNDING (id:1708) having fabricated 430 employee count with placeholder data. Found widespread issues across 368 companies.

fakeLinkedinUrls.description: Company linkedinUrl field contained website URL copy-paste instead of actual LinkedIn company page URL
fakeLinkedinUrls.fix: Set to undefined where URL doesn't contain linkedin.com
fakeLinkedinUrls.rootCause: Enrichment pipeline defaulted to copying website URL when LinkedIn could not be found

placeholderLeaders.description: Leaders with names like 'Management Team', 'Leadership Team', 'Executive Team' instead of real people
placeholderLeaders.rootCause: Research agents created fake leader entries when no leadership information could be found

fabricatedNews.description: News items sourced from 'Industry Reports, 2025' — not a real publication. Template headlines like 'Operates as Major X-Based Y'
fabricatedNews.rootCause: Research agents fabricated news when no real press coverage existed

falseDeepResearchedTag.description: Companies tagged 'deep-researched' with zero real leaders and no verified news
falseDeepResearchedTag.rootCause: Tag was applied in bulk by agents regardless of whether real data was found

wrongEmployeeCount.description: UFS (id:1767) listed 9,000 employees — impossible for a Brooklyn MCA shop
wrongEmployeeCount.rootCause: Data entry error or confusion with different company

recommendations: Strip 'deep-researched' tag from companies with only placeholder data
Null out linkedinUrl where it doesn't contain linkedin.com
Remove 'Management Team' leader entries — empty is better than fake
Prioritize Lendistry, Grameen America, Wayflyer for real research
Audit 'Industry Reports' news items — replace or remove
Add validation to enrichment pipeline: reject placeholder data, require real names
